meanings.definition: A small, round object used in the game of marbles.
meanings.sent1: Tommy won three luggies in the marble game.
meanings.sent2: The children played with colorful luggies on the playground.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's luggies rolled perfectly, winning her the game.
meanings.sent4: The luggies clinked together as they collided in the circle.
meanings.sent5: The shiny luggies sparkled under the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A small, narrow passageway or alley.
meanings.sent1: The cat squeezed through the luggies between the buildings.
meanings.sent2: The shortcut to the market was through a dark luggies.
meanings.sent3: The luggies behind the house led to a hidden garden.
meanings.sent4: The luggies were so narrow, only one person could pass at a time.
meanings.sent5: The luggies were lined with colorful graffiti, adding charm to the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To carry or haul something heavy or awkward.
meanings.sent1: Dad had to luggies the heavy boxes up to the attic.
meanings.sent2: The movers had to luggies the piano carefully down the stairs.
meanings.sent3: I had to luggies the giant pumpkin to the contest on my own.
meanings.sent4: She luggies her backpack everywhere she goes, filled with books.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to luggies the massive statue into the museum for display.
